layout_name: Lead List with Avatar and Status

summary.text: Lead list view showing multiple lead records with avatars, names, company information, and status badges. Each lead displayed as a card with quick action buttons. Perfect for scanning multiple leads at once with visual identification.

query_variants.text: show my leads | display lead list | view all leads | get my leads | show leads | list my leads | view lead records

structure.text: Stack[vertical] > ListCard[repeat] > (Avatar + Heading[name] + Text[company] + Badge[status] + Button[view])

use_case.text: Best for displaying multiple lead records in a scannable list format with visual identification through avatars. Suitable when users need to browse through leads and take quick actions. Ideal for 3-50 lead records.

summary.text: Structured table layout for contact records with sortable columns and inline filters. Shows contacts in rows with columns for name, email, phone, company, and status. Includes header with title and action buttons.

query_variants.text: show contact table | display all contacts | view contact list | contact data table | show contacts in table | list contacts structured

structure.text: Card > Heading + Table[columns: name, email, phone, company, status | sortable: true | filterable: true]

use_case.text: Best for displaying contact records in a structured, comparable format. Perfect when users need to sort, filter, and scan across multiple attributes. Ideal for 10-1000 contact records with multiple data points per contact.

summary.text: Executive sales dashboard displaying key performance indicators in a grid layout. Shows total revenue, deal count, win rate, and other sales metrics with trend indicators. Includes charts and visualizations for pipeline analysis.

query_variants.text: sales dashboard | show sales metrics | sales KPI dashboard | sales performance overview | sales summary | executive sales view | sales analytics

structure.text: Stack[horizontal, wrap] > Card[repeat] > (Metric[value, label, trend] + Dashlet[chart])

use_case.text: Best for displaying aggregated sales metrics and KPIs in an executive summary format. Perfect for quick performance overview at a glance. Ideal for dashboard views with 4-12 key metrics.

summary.text: Comprehensive single lead detail view with all information organized in logical sections. Shows lead name, company, contact details, status, revenue, owner, and description. Includes action buttons for edit, delete, convert.

query_variants.text: show lead details | view lead information | lead profile | display lead record | get lead info | show my lead | lead detail page

structure.text: Card > Stack[vertical] > (Avatar + Heading[name] + Badge[status] + Divider + Stack[Label + Text][repeat for fields])

use_case.text: Best for displaying complete information about a single lead record. Perfect for detail pages where all lead attributes need to be visible. Ideal for profile views and comprehensive record display.

summary.text: Opportunity pipeline list showing deals with amount, stage, probability, and close date. Each opportunity card displays key metrics with color-coded stage badges. Sorted by amount or close date with filtering options.

query_variants.text: show opportunities | view pipeline | opportunity list | show deals | display active opportunities | sales pipeline | opportunity view

structure.text: Stack[vertical] > ListCard[repeat] > (Heading[name] + Text[account] + Metric[amount] + Badge[stage] + Text[close_date])

use_case.text: Best for displaying opportunity pipeline with financial metrics prominently shown. Perfect for sales teams tracking deals through stages. Ideal for 5-50 opportunity records with emphasis on monetary values.

summary.text: Special celebratory cards for contacts with birthdays. Features festive styling with avatar, name, age, and birthday message. Designed for birthday reminders and celebration notifications.

query_variants.text: show birthdays | contacts with birthdays | birthday list | upcoming birthdays | birthday reminders | celebrate birthdays | birthday notifications

use_case.text: Best for displaying birthday celebrations and special events. Perfect for CRM engagement features showing upcoming contact birthdays. Ideal for 1-10 celebration cards with personal touch.

summary.text: Chronological timeline of activities and events with timestamps. Each activity shows type badge, user avatar, description, and relative time. Grouped by date with dividers for better organization.

query_variants.text: show activities | activity timeline | recent activities | activity history | activity log | show recent events | activity feed

structure.text: Stack[vertical] > Card[repeat] > (Label[timestamp] + Avatar[user] + Badge[activity_type] + Text[description] + Divider)

use_case.text: Best for displaying chronological activity history and event logs. Perfect for tracking user actions, status changes, and communication history. Ideal for 10-100 activity records ordered by time.

summary.text: Compact list view with prominent status badges and key information. Optimized for quick scanning of filtered records with visual status indicators. Shows name, company, status badge, and revenue metric in compact cards.

query_variants.text: filter by status | show hot leads | status filtered list | leads by status | filter leads status | show status hot | status view

structure.text: Stack[vertical] > Card[compact, repeat] > (Badge[status, prominent] + Heading[name] + Text[company] + Metric[revenue])

use_case.text: Best for displaying filtered lists with status as primary criteria. Perfect for quick status-based filtering and scanning. Ideal for 5-20 records where status visibility is key.

summary.text: Grid layout of account cards with company logos, names, and key metrics. Cards arranged in responsive grid showing visual company identification with industry, revenue, and employee count. Perfect for browsing accounts visually.

query_variants.text: show accounts | account grid | view all accounts | account cards | display accounts | company list | account overview

structure.text: Stack[horizontal, wrap] > Card[repeat, fixed-width] > (Image[logo] + Heading[name] + Text[industry] + Metric[revenue] + Badge[status])

use_case.text: Best for displaying accounts in a visual, browsable grid format. Perfect when company logos add value to identification. Ideal for 6-50 account records with visual branding elements.

summary.text: Vertical form layout for creating new leads with labeled input fields. Organized in logical sections with required field indicators. Includes validation hints and submit/cancel action buttons.

query_variants.text: create lead | new lead form | add lead | create new lead | lead entry form | add new lead | lead creation

structure.text: Card > Stack[vertical] > (Heading[form_title] + Stack[repeat: Label + Text][fields] + Button[submit] + Button[cancel])

use_case.text: Best for creating new lead records through structured data entry. Perfect for add/create workflows requiring form input. Ideal for single record creation with 5-15 input fields.

summary.text: AI-generated insights and recommendations card with prominent visual styling. Shows intelligent suggestions, confidence scores, and recommended actions. Designed to highlight data-driven predictions and next best actions.

query_variants.text: show insights | AI recommendations | smart suggestions | get insights | show AI analysis | intelligent suggestions | predictive insights

structure.text: Card[elevated] > Heading[insights] + Insights[text, confidence] + Text[explanation] + Button[action]

use_case.text: Best for displaying AI-generated insights and smart recommendations. Perfect for highlighting intelligent analysis and predictions. Ideal for 1-3 key insights with actionable suggestions.

summary.text: Empty state placeholder displayed when no data is available. Features illustration, helpful message, and action button to get started. Provides guidance for first-time users or empty result sets.

query_variants.text: no data | empty state | no results | zero state | nothing to show | no records found | empty view

structure.text: Card[centered, large-padding] > Image[illustration] + Heading[message] + Text[description] + Button[call_to_action]

use_case.text: Best for handling cases with no data or empty results. Perfect for onboarding new users or showing filtered results with zero matches. Ideal for guiding users to take action when facing empty content.
